nodes.title: Applied Mathematics
nodes.summary:
Applied Mathematics

Applied Mathematics focuses on the creation and study of mathematical and computational tools that will solve challenging problems in science and engineering.

Read more...

nodes.title: Applied Physics
nodes.summary:
Applied Physics

Research in applied physics covers the interfaces of physics, chemistry, biology, and engineering.

Read more...

nodes.title: Bioengineering
nodes.summary:
Bioengineering

Bioengineering at SEAS involves the application of engineering principles and techniques to address questions in biology and medicine.

Read more...

nodes.title: Computer Science
nodes.summary:
Computer Science

Computer scientists at SEAS perform ground-breaking research in computational theory, systems & networks, privacy & security, artificial intelligence, imaging, linguistics, and more.

Read more...

nodes.title: Electrical Engineering
nodes.summary:
Electrical Engineering

Electrical Engineering covers a range of research areas from devices to systems, offering ample research opportunities, both theoretical and experimental, at the forefront of the field and its interdisciplinary applications.

Read more...

nodes.title: Environmental Science & Engineering
nodes.summary:
Environmental Science & Engineering

Our society's influence on the natural world's resources has never been more significant or problematic than it is today.

Read more...

nodes.title: Materials Science & Mechanical Engineering
nodes.summary:
Materials Science & Mechanical Engineering

Materials Science & Mechanical Engineering research ranges from fundamental work in solid and fluid mechanics to diverse studies in materials, mechanical systems, and biomechanics.

Read more...

nodes.title: Computational Science & Engineering
nodes.summary:
Computational Science & Engineering

Computational Science and Engineering is an exciting and rapidly evolving field that exploits the power of computation as an approach to major challenges on the frontiers of natural and social science and all engineering fields.

Read more...

nodes.title: (GR) Applied Mathematics
nodes.summary:
Graduate Program in Applied Mathematics

Students interested in Applied Mathematics may earn their Doctor of Philosophy through SEAS. Doctoral students may earn the masters degree en route to the Ph.D.

Read more...

nodes.title: (GR) Applied Physics
nodes.summary:
Graduate Program in Applied Physics

Students interested in Applied Physics may earn their Doctor of Philosophy through SEAS. Doctoral students may earn the masters degree en route to the Ph.D.

Read more...

nodes.title: (GR) Computer Science
nodes.summary:
Graduate Program in Computer Science

Students interested in Computer Science may earn their Master of Science, Master of Engineering, or Doctor of Philosophy through SEAS.

Read more...

nodes.title: (GR) Engineering Sciences
nodes.summary:
Graduate Program in Engineering Sciences

Four variants of the Engineering Sciences degree are offered: Bioengineering, Electrical Engineering, Environmental Science and Engineering, and Mechanical Engineering.

Read more...

nodes.title: (UG) Applied Mathematics
nodes.summary:
Undergraduate Program in Applied Mathematics

The fundamental aim of the applied mathematics concentration at Harvard is to provide a structure for students to combine their interest in mathematics and mathematical reasoning, with an interest in a specific field of intellectual activity.

Read more...

nodes.title: (UG) Biomedical Engineering
nodes.summary:
Undergraduate Program in Biomedical Engineering

Biomedical engineering lies at the intersection of the physical and life sciences, incorporating principles from physics and chemistry to understand the operation of living systems.

Read more...

nodes.title: (UG) Computer Science
nodes.summary:
Undergraduate Program in Computer Science

Participate in research on software, graphics, artificial intelligence, networks, parallel and distributed systems, algorithms, and theory.

Read more...

nodes.title: (UG) Electrical Engineering
nodes.summary:
Undergraduate Program in Electrical Engineering

The EE S.B. concentration debuted in the Fall of 2012, providing students with a basic underlying scientific and engineering principles.

Read more...

nodes.title: (UG) Engineering Sciences
nodes.summary:
Undergraduate Program in Engineering Sciences

Engineering is about building bridges... but in ways you may not expect.

Read more...

nodes.title: (UG) Mechanical Engineering
nodes.summary:
Undergraduate Program in Mechanical Engineering

Mechanical Engineering (ME) is a foundational discipline, critical to the success of many human enterprises. It plays a central role in energy, the transport sector, the manufacturing of consumables and durable goods, and the development of infrastructure.

Read more...
